守.definition: to guard; to defend; to keep watch; to abide by the law; to observe (rules or ritual); nearby; adjoining

守一而終.definition: to be faithful to one's mate all one's life

守住.definition: to hold on to; to defend; to keep; to guard

守候.definition: to wait for; to expect; to keep watch; to watch over; to nurse

守備.definition: to garrison; to stand guard; on garrison duty

守分.definition: to abide by the law; to respect the law

守制.definition: to go into mourning for one's parents

守口如瓶.definition: lit. to guard one's mouth like a closed bottle (idiom); tight-lipped; reticent; not breathing a word

守喪.definition: to keep watch beside a coffin; to observe a period of mourning

守土.definition: to guard one's territory; to protect the country

守夜.definition: to be on all-night duty; to be on night watch; to keep a vigil

守孝.definition: to observe mourning for one's parents

守寡.definition: to live as widow; to observe widowhood

守恆.definition: conservation (e.g. of energy, momentum or heat in physics); to remain constant (of a number)

守成.definition: to preserve the accomplishments of previous generations; to carry on the good work of one's predecessors

守更.definition: to keep watch during the night

守服.definition: to observe mourning for one's parents

守望相助.definition: to keep watch and defend one another (idiom, from Mencius); to join forces to defend against external aggressors; mutual help and protection

守株待兔.definition: lit. to guard a tree-stump, waiting for rabbits (idiom); to wait idly for opportunities; to trust to chance rather than show initiative

守株待兔，緣木求魚.pinyin: shou3 zhu1 dai4 tu4 , yuan2 mu4 qiu2 yu2
守株待兔，緣木求魚.definition: to guard a tree-stump, waiting for rabbits, and climb a tree to catch fish (idiom); without any practical course of action

守株緣木.definition: abbr. for 守株待兔，緣木求魚|守株待兔，缘木求鱼[shou3 zhu1 dai4 tu4 , yuan2 mu4 qiu2 yu2]

守業.definition: to preserve one's heritage; to defend the accomplishments of previous generations; to carry on the good work; to keep one's business going

守正不阿.definition: to be strictly just and impartial

守歲.definition: to see in the New Year; to stay up all night on lunar New Year's Eve

守活寡.definition: to stay at home while one's husband is away; grass widow

守空房.definition: to stay home alone (of married woman)

守節.definition: faithful (to the memory of betrothed); constant (of widow who remains unmarried)

守約.definition: to keep an appointment; to keep one's word

守職.definition: to observe one's duty steadfastly; devoted to one's job

守舊派.definition: person who sticks to old ways; a diehard; a conservative

守規矩.definition: to behave oneself; to abide by the rules

守身.definition: to keep oneself pure; to preserve one's integrity; to remain chaste

守身如玉.definition: to keep oneself pure; to preserve one's integrity; to remain chaste

守門.definition: to keep goal; on duty as gatekeeper

守靈.definition: to keep watch beside a coffin
